commit_message:
Move skip condition under skip_checks method

Currently, the validation of existing multiple backends is preformed
in resource_setup stage in stead of skip_checks stage.

Change-Id: I4101ddc8b795276cc2327b2e38d7803d63913043

deleted_lines: if len(backend_names) < 2: raise cls.skipException("Requires at least two different " "backend names")

commit_message:
Handle token_endpoint auth type in osc plugin

There can be situations where the auth_type=token_endpoint, we
should use the appropriate attributes from the auth plugin when
creating heatclient.

Change-Id: Ic929f6ceaa92002eb2b3443934d1f541758e4dda
Closes-Bug: #1632341
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/69/389069/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if instance.auth_plugin_name == 'token_endpoint': kwargs.update({'endpoint': instance.auth.url, 'token': instance.auth.token}) else: endpoint = instance.get_endpoint_for_service_type( API_NAME, region_name=instance.region_name, interface=instance.interface, ) kwargs.update({'endpoint': endpoint, 'auth_url': instance.auth.auth_url, 'username': instance.auth_ref.username, 'token': instance.auth_ref.auth_token})
deleted_lines: endpoint = instance.get_endpoint_for_service_type( API_NAME, region_name=instance.region_name, interface=instance.interface, ) kwargs.update({'endpoint': endpoint, 'auth_url': instance.auth.auth_url, 'username': instance.auth_ref.username, 'token': instance.auth_ref.auth_token})

commit_message:
Use preferred option where possible

The --images-file and --env-file options of `openstack overcloud
container image prepare` command were renamed to --output-images-file
and --output-env-file for clarity. Use them wherever possible (pike and
above).

Change-Id: Ie76f08e7a2ac2021ec0b66afa1292bc2eef00b8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/08/573208/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --output-images-file {{ working_dir }}/overcloud_containers.yaml \ --output-env-file {{ working_dir }}/containers-default-parameters.yaml \ --output-images-file {{ working_dir }}/containers_update.yaml \

commit_message:
Add IPv6 ND Neighbor Advertiser application

A new extension to the Dragonflow's l2 application.
It enables the controller identify Neighbor Socialitation requests,
and adds a flow that advertise the response.

Partially-implements: blueprint ipv6
Partial-bug: #1480672

Change-Id: I2ea30f5363f7d895cbe4ead5f630713dccc95da4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/08/412208/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def ipv6_text_to_int(ip_text): if isinstance(ip_text, unicode): ip_text = ip_text.encode('ascii', 'ignore') try: return list(struct.unpack('!8H', addrconv.ipv6.text_to_bin(ip_text))) except Exception: raise exceptions.InvalidIPAddressException(key=ip_text)

commit_message:
Delete the 'share_extension:types_extra_specs' policy

The 'share_extension:types_extra_specs' policy were deleted
in mitaka [1]. Now use 'share_types_extra_spec:index' instead
of 'share_extension:types_extra_specs' policy

[1] I334cc0fa8e69c2f9b5226f247149a0b9b748dd60

Closes-bug: #1715522
Change-Id: I334cc0fa8e69c2f9b5226f247149a0b9b748dd31
(cherry picked from commit c485309e2aa1270550f2e039b092e672d7f7bbd9)

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 API service client usage

Volume v1 API has been gone since long and Tempest also
marked their deprecation since Juno
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446238/

Now Tempest is removing the deprecated config option and
alias for voluem v1 service client in
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Before the Tempest patch gets merged, we need to remove all usage
of volume v1 things.

Change-Id: Ifcf420582644281b792c501c3e438a2c91c335b2
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar-tempest-plugin refs/changes/64/573164/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if CONF.volume_feature_enabled.api_v2 or CONF.volume_feature_enabled.api_v3: cls.volumes_client = cls.os_primary.volumes_client_latest cls.snapshots_client = cls.os_primary.snapshots_client_latest
deleted_lines: if CONF.volume_feature_enabled.api_v2: cls.volumes_client = cls.os_primary.volumes_v2_client cls.snapshots_client = cls.os_primary.snapshots_v2_client else: cls.volumes_client = cls.os_primary.volumes_client cls.snapshots_client = cls.os_primary.snapshots_client

Change-Id: I69783f75600048b9c4b2abb445b59e135029f3df
Partial-Bug: 1557790
"}]
commit_message:
Use OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD instead of passing CLI

When bootstrapping use environment variable
OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD instead of passing password
over CLI since it's a possible leak.

Change-Id: I69783f75600048b9c4b2abb445b59e135029f3df
Partial-Bug: 1557790
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/63/559063/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :command => 'keystone-manage bootstrap', :environment => 'OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD=service_password',

commit_message:
Add local-registry image managment to OSH from OSH-Infra

This PS adds the local registry image managment to OSH from OSH-Infra.
With this the delta between helm-toolkits in the Repo's is removed,
allowing the toolkit from OSH-Infra to be used and the one from OSH
to be depreciated.

Change-Id: I09a0aa375ab6e7f38f342ed9c4dcde817b82056c

commit_message:
Corp-Proxy: Add proxy options to helm-toolkit driven pods

This PS adds the ability to expose proxy settings to the pod
manifests withing helm-toolkit.

Change-Id: Icb229096397d24bf7cc824a7dbba7fa9e289c96f

Helm: move to current stable version (v1.8.2)

This PS moves helm to the current stable version, which should have
fixed the issues seen with early 2.8.x releases.

name: ceph-init-dirs image: {{ .Values.images.tags.ceph_daemon }} imagePullPolicy: {{ .Values.images.pull_policy }} command: - /tmp/init-dirs.sh env: - name: CLUSTER value: "ceph" volumeMounts: - name: ceph-mon-bin mountPath: /tmp/init-dirs.sh subPath: init-dirs.sh readOnly: true - name: pod-var-lib-ceph mountPath: /var/lib/ceph readOnly: false - name: pod-run mountPath: /run readOnly: false - name: pod-etc-ceph mountPath: /etc/ceph containers: - name: ceph-mgr image: {{ .Values.images.tags.ceph_daemon }} imagePullPolicy: {{ .Values.images.pull_policy }} {{ tuple $envAll $envAll.Values.pod.resources.mgr | include "helm-toolkit.snippets.kubernetes_resources" | indent 10 }} env: - name: CLUSTER value: "ceph" {{- if .Values.ceph_mgr_enabled_modules }} - name: ENABLED_MODULES value: |- {{- range $value := .Values.ceph_mgr_enabled_modules }} {{ $value }} {{- end }} {{- end }} {{- if .Values.ceph_mgr_modules_config }} {{- range $module,$params := .Values.ceph_mgr_modules_config }} {{- range $key, $value := $params }} - name: {{ $module }}_{{ $key }} value: {{ $value | quote }} {{- end }} {{- end }} {{- end }} command: - /mgr-start.sh livenessProbe: exec: command: - /tmp/mgr-check.sh - liveness initialDelaySeconds: 30 timeoutSeconds: 5 readinessProbe: exec: command: - /tmp/mgr-check.sh - readiness initialDelaySeconds: 30 timeoutSeconds: 5 volumeMounts: - name: ceph-mon-bin mountPath: /mgr-start.sh subPath: mgr-start.sh readOnly: true - name: ceph-mon-bin mountPath: /tmp/mgr-check.sh subPath: mgr-check.sh readOnly: true - name: pod-etc-ceph mountPath: /etc/ceph - name: ceph-mon-etc mountPath: /etc/ceph/ceph.conf subPath: ceph.conf readOnly: true - name: ceph-client-admin-keyring mountPath: /etc/ceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring subPath: ceph.client.admin.keyring readOnly: true - name: ceph-mon-keyring mountPath: /etc/ceph/ceph.mon.keyring subPath: ceph.mon.keyring readOnly: true - name: ceph-bootstrap-osd-keyring mountPath: /var/lib/ceph/bootstrap-osd/ceph.keyring subPath: ceph.keyring readOnly: false - name: ceph-bootstrap-mds-keyring mountPath: /var/lib/ceph/bootstrap-mds/ceph.keyring subPath: ceph.keyring readOnly: false - name: ceph-bootstrap-mgr-keyring mountPath: /var/lib/ceph/bootstrap-mgr/ceph.keyring subPath: ceph.keyring readOnly: false - name: pod-var-lib-ceph mountPath: /var/lib/ceph readOnly: false - name: pod-run mountPath: /run readOnly: false volumes: - name: pod-etc-ceph emptyDir: {} - name: ceph-mon-bin configMap: name: ceph-mon-bin defaultMode: 0555 - name: ceph-mon-etc configMap: name: ceph-mon-etc defaultMode: 0444 - name: pod-var-lib-ceph emptyDir: {} - name: pod-run emptyDir: medium: "Memory" - name: ceph-client-admin-keyring secret: secretName: {{ .Values.secrets.keyrings.admin }} - commit_message:
Gate: Deploy service specific rabbit and memcache in multinode gate

This PS moves each service to use its own memcache and rabbitmq when
running in the multinode gate.

Change-Id: I8ecc91a8680ff67db465a9375a0b81f2e5036454

commit_message:
DNM: Armada based deploy of OSH on Promenade based K8s Cluster

This PS demos a armada based deployment of OSH on a Promenade
based K8s cluster

Change-Id: I933869c78741785418cd887623e0982501a730b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm refs/changes/65/549665/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #/bin/bash HELM_VERSION="v2.7.2" KUBE_VERSION="v1.9.3" sudo apt-get install -y python3-pip sudo pip3 install --upgrade pip sudo apt-get install -y python-pip sudo pip install --upgrade pip # Remove bootstrap client scripts sudo rm -rf /usr/local/bin/armada sudo rm -rf /usr/local/bin/helm sudo rm -rf /usr/local/bin/kubectl hash -r # Make sane kubeconfig sudo mkdir -p ~/.kube sudo chown -R ubuntu:ubuntu ~/.kube cp -r /etc/kubernetes/admin/pki ~/.kube/pki cat /etc/kubernetes/admin/kubeconfig.yaml | sed -e 's/\/etc\/kubernetes\/admin/./' > ~/.kube/config # Pull in kube client sudo curl -sSL -o /usr/bin/kubectl \ https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/${KUBE_VERSION}/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl sudo chmod +x /usr/bin/kubectl # Pull in helm client TMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d) curl -sSL https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-helm/helm-${HELM_VERSION}-linux-amd64.tar.gz | tar -zxv --strip-components=1 -C ${TMP_DIR} sudo mv ${TMP_DIR}/helm /usr/bin/helm rm -rf ${TMP_DIR} # Setup Helm helm init --client-only helm serve & sleep 5 helm repo add local http://localhost:8879/charts helm repo remove stable # Bring in OSH-Infra and build tiller chart sudo mkdir -p /opt/openstack-helm-infra sudo chown -R ubuntu:ubuntu /opt/openstack-helm-infra git clone https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/ /opt/openstack-helm-infra cd /opt/openstack-helm-infra make # Run a tiller to bootstrap chart sudo docker run -d \ --name helm-tiller \ --net=host \ -e KUBECONFIG=${HOME}/.kube/config \ -v ${HOME}/.kube:${HOME}/.kube:ro \ gcr.io/kubernetes-helm/tiller:${HELM_VERSION} export HELM_HOST=localhost:44134 # Deploy tiller helm install /opt/openstack-helm-infra/tiller --name tiller --namespace kube-system --wait # Clean up sudo docker rm -f helm-tiller unset HELM_HOST sleep 30 #Check helm helm ls #Deploy Armada TMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d) git clone http://github.com/att-comdev/armada.git ${TMP_DIR}/armada sudo pip3 install ${TMP_DIR}/armada sudo make build -C ${TMP_DIR}/armada sudo rm -rf ${TMP_DIR} # Bring in OSH sudo mkdir -p /opt/openstack-helm sudo chown -R ubuntu:ubuntu /opt/openstack-helm git clone https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/ /opt/openstack-helm cd /opt/openstack-helm make # Run Gate #./tools/deployment/developer/common/000-install-packages.sh #./tools/deployment/armada/020-armada-render-manifests.sh #./tools/deployment/armada/025-armada-validate-manifests.sh #./tools/deployment/armada/030-armada-apply-manifests.sh

commit_message:
NFS: Add NFS chart backed by pvc for systems without CephFS support

This PS adds an NFS deployment backed by and RBD device for systems
where CephFS is not supported.

Change-Id: I8a9dc5f9cac262c206830bdef9288245c5d0143c

commit_message:
Gate: disable unbound and setup dns in nodepool VMs

This ps disables the unbound service and points resolv.conf to the
upstream servers directly when running in nodepool. It is required
to avoid confict with both the kubedns service (which will be used
in place of unbound) and the ingress controllers in OSH.

Change-Id: I92745430d9bb9a411e82bc5fe82e3aa982dc020b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/33/533433/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Disable Unbound on Nodepool VMs when: nodepool is defined block: - name: setup resolv conf on nodepool vms template: src: resolv.conf.j2 dest: /etc/resolv.conf mode: 0640 - name: stop and disable the unbound service on nodepool vms systemd: state: stoped daemon_reload: yes name: unbound enabled: no

commit_message:
Images: Gnocchi service specific explicit image names

This PS makes the service-specific images for Gnocchi have
explicit names, allowing simple over-riding of images for an
entire site.

Change-Id: I0886f7ef65def90e5c51e88bf74b47bb95ddbe78

commit_message:
Images: Update names to reflect service specific functions

This PS updates the Image variable names to refect service specific
functionality. By doing so it is much easier to track common images
between charts and also provide a simpler interface for testing
different images (eg when changing openstack release, distro or
source - ie. Kolla/LOCI).

Change-Id: I35c7926c0ec54dbc3e3cd8ecd0759e09939edac4

commit_message:
[log] Add default log chains into iptables for logging driver

This patch adds the following log chains into iptables base on discussed
in the patch [1]
- neutron-l3-agent-accepted
- neutron-l3-agent-dropped
- neutron-l3-agent-rejected
These log chains is added to replace ACCEPT, DROP and REJECT action in
logging driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509725/

Partial-Bug: #1720727
Change-Id: I727c5485f3e1c03c7f20b3fffcb5b6773255453b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/52/573952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add .stestr.conf configuration

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. While this
is usually compaible with existing settings, there is a warning
that is emitted when .stestr.conf is not present. It is usually
able to fall back to parsing the .testr.conf file, but to be more
correct and to prevent future problems we should update the config.

Change-Id: Ic50b076276333c4c1e846f9e2d401f9c62aadf57

commit_message:
Silence files copying logs

Those logs can be found in the produced jobs' artifacts as well,
no need to list those in the console logs. The lists are huge
and bring no useful info.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7c3281bf2ecb9808d7042611a66c957eb8f4c79
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator refs/changes/03/572903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I80b988b11224df83cdd9ff18aeaf03af6adea293
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tosca-parser refs/changes/30/572930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I1d990e8c9ab2d979a5e462361cf7a8e3d461138c

commit_message:
remove safe_reference from common db mixin

The safe_reference property in common db mixin is only used by
vmware-nsx and they can use weakref directly (see depends on patch).
This patch removes safe_reference as we're working towards removing
common db mixin all together.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571221/

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.safe_reference

Change-Id: I77f9561139fd88eff51638f6f41cf79f0b876dc1

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

subunit lower-constraint raised because stestr now has a minimum of 1.3.0
networkx kept at 1.11 for breakage
  * https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1718576
eventlet kept at 0.20.0 for breakage
google-auth and google-api-python-client kept at current for cinder breakage
  * https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1775218
Sphinx kep at 1.6.5 for docs breakage
pyldap, removed post1 again
urllib3 is being held back because of requests
  * https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4673
pexpect is being held back for ansible-runner
  * https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner/issues/44

Change-Id: I7e4a927db7a20eaa7ee2921868df01c2acf5aa2e

commit_message:
Wait for interface to detach for all interface tests

This patchset waits for interfaces to detach during
test clean up in MiscPolicyActionsNetworkRbacTest.
This is a follow up to [0], which missed clean up
for certain tests.

[0] I7b1a095bb73f4814b756f9493f9e353a8f98e7da

Change-Id: I041aaa7dce53f920b014c1cb586dc6bb3c10b489

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Update tests to clean up test data and index

This ps adds a function for cleaning up the test data used to
verify Elasticsearch is functioning properly. It removes the test
index created and populated with test data to ensure the resulting
elasticsearch cluster is clean and does not contain random data

Change-Id: Ibdeb90e3f3b6307bf16c68469556bef256ed2d78

commit_message:
Remove moxstubout usage

In newer versions of oslotest, moxstubout is deprecated.
So drop it now so we can get out in front of it.

Change-Id: I9ccf476574974b7edc70be444856b38478070709
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Node Exporter: Remove megacli collector due to deprecation

This removes the megacli collector from the node exporter, as this
collector is no longer supported and supplied as part of the node
exporter image used.

Change-Id: Ic9d7bc906435227337aed7a40f4c25bbb16fd3ba

commit_message:
Update "auth_url" in install docs

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url" in docs.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I9307a0ac622086f2722b89b78cf0903399942dd1

commit_message:
Cleanup ironic.conf template

This patch removes some deprecated options from ironic config file
template in preparation to their removal from ironic itself:

- remove SSH section, the SSH driver is no longer supported by ironic
- remove [keystone] section altogether, the only option there is
  region_name which is deprecated, use it explicitly in [inspector] and
  [service_catalog] sections when keystone support is enabled
- remove [conductor]api_url option, instead use
  [service_catalog]endpoint_override option
- fix logic in [inspector] section templating, add keystoneauth options
  only when inspector itself is enabled.

Change-Id: Ie4fd92ff2af6b300b0f6ceeaa40538a6c1176e6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/15/572815/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: region_name = {{ keystone.bootstrap.region_name | default('RegionOne')}}{% endif %}{% endif %}{% if enable_keystone is defined and enable_keystone | bool == true %}project_name = {{ ironic.service_catalog.project_name }}user_domain_id = default project_domain_id = default region_name = {{ keystone.bootstrap.region_name | default('RegionOne')}} {% else %} auth_type = none endpoint_override = http://{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['ansible_' + ans_network_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }}:6385
deleted_lines: api_url = http://{{ hostvars[inventory_hostname]['ansible_' + ans_network_interface]['ipv4']['address'] }}:6385/{% if testing | bool == true %} [ssh] libvirt_uri = qemu:///system {% endif %} {% endif %}[keystone] region_name = {{ keystone.bootstrap.region_name | default('RegionOne')}}tenant_name = {{ ironic.service_catalog.project_name }}

and must be adapted to the new code base.
Furthermore it fixes some typos.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic56f510130cabac2daa04eb9dbca8edd65e6a803

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4e51031d5b0d3f47e185b1370254baafa8eb47a1

commit_message:
Add a new tempest job with a mock datasource

In this tempest job, the mock datasource is used to create an entity
graph with ~20,000 vertices. This job will contain tests for
init procedure, processes, restarts, multiple api calls.

Other data sources are disabled. Heat, Telemetry, Mistral
are not installed.

Depends-On: I9c4c329983bbe5930de5484fa6932b318746ed5c
Depends-On: Ice708f4aaf6132e4e8a7ae6352112f8b563b95b8

Change-Id: I6fd5c70efa6f722461d36c1cd1aa94352e6e4596

commit_message:
Fix issues in nova-show-usage-statistics-for-hosts-instances.rst

1. url for `Ceilometer` doc is not correct
2. nova-cert has been removed
   (change I2c78a0c6599b92040146cf9f0042cff8fd2509c3)
   and should no appear in the example
3. phrasing issue in explanation for "used_now" of host resource
   usage
4. 'opensack server list' repsonse is different from that of 'nova list'
5. add info about diagnostic statistics format


Change-Id: I6a2a7b396fee2a5cbae633d5c259f5f0961b9b60

commit_message:
changes to graph stop and init

1. Evaluators to receive updates of actions executed during init

During init evaluator workers will not receive evaluator
actions (aka new alarm/states/etc..) as the queues are
read before the processor graph calls subscribe. hence
their graph may not be in sync

2. More robust vitrage-graph stop

Change-Id: Ice708f4aaf6132e4e8a7ae6352112f8b563b95b8

commit_message:
WIP: Update coverage job to use stestr

Make it fail this time, set coverage threshold
to 92.

Update the coverage job to use stestr
and bring it in line with other projects
and use '--fail-under 90' to prevent
regressions rather than running the job
twice and comparing results.

Change-Id: I9a5e2ab5da9809a2c7eb69c3d7da195c9151e2a7

commit_message:
vars: Do not install MySQL-python

We do not need to install the MySQL-python module since nothing really
needs it. The purpose of this role is to simply install the mysql client
on the host. As such we can drop this module and all the devel packages
which are required to build it.

Change-Id: I6535479bf2ca915e37b48c673024390baac7dd41

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia8ba790125fb3610d41b19ca682efca9012a5b7b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-vitrageclient refs/changes/60/573360/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iab2f7ba28ad2a63e0801ba43f3b9c467f7389524

commit_message:
Return all providers - single provider

Getting allocation candidates, in provider_summaries we have only
providers that are in allocation_requests.

This patch fixes it to include all the providers in trees in play
for RequestGroups with ``use_same_provider=True``.

Change-Id: Ibf9699f515910befceac399aa589d59d2598b366
Blueprint: placement-return-all-resources

added_lines: # Same, but with the request in a granular group, which hits a # different code path. alloc_cands = self._get_allocation_candidates( {'': placement_lib.RequestGroup( use_same_provider=True, resources={ fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF: 1, }, )} ) expected = [ [('cn_numa0_pf0', fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF, 1)], [('cn_numa1_pf1', fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF, 1)], ] self._validate_allocation_requests(expected, alloc_cands) expected = { 'cn': set([ (fields.ResourceClass.VCPU, 16, 0), (fields.ResourceClass.MEMORY_MB, 32768, 0), ]), 'cn_numa0': set([]), 'cn_numa1': set([]), 'cn_numa0_pf0': set([ (fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF, 8, 0), ]), 'cn_numa1_pf1': set([ (fields.ResourceClass.SRIOV_NET_VF, 8, 0), ]), } self._validate_provider_summary_resources(expected, alloc_cands) expected = { 'cn': set([]), 'cn_numa0': set([]), 'cn_numa1': set([]), 'cn_numa0_pf0': set([]), 'cn_numa1_pf1': set([os_traits.HW_NIC_OFFLOAD_GENEVE]), } self._validate_provider_summary_traits(expected, alloc_cands)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I11b311684849dfa9bf19d05eed0b4fa515176a13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/94/573994/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

GET /allocation_candidates placement API. By default

with existing deployments, and requires system scope

With this change, we have all of the placement route

Change-Id: I8ed5d00daf1b5a0ad46256ffb27a75e1e602cea3
"}]
commit_message:
Add granular policy rules for allocation candidates

This adds the granular policy rule for the
GET /allocation_candidates placement API. By default
it requires role:admin so it's backward compatible
with existing deployments, and requires system scope
tokens.

With this change, we have all of the placement route
handlers covered using per-route policy checks so the
temporary PER_ROUTE_POLICY variable is dropped.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I8ed5d00daf1b5a0ad46256ffb27a75e1e602cea3

commit_message:
Gate: fix waiting for nodes following zuul ansible update

For some reason it appears that the task to wait for nodes to come up
requires privilege escalation to work. I suspect this is due to
interation between ansible 2.5.4 and zuuls log streamer, but am not
sure. In the meantime this PS unblocks the gates.

Change-Id: I705f2ddf3facfe56838f606f88cfb15b822d18a5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Bootstrap-Jobs: Use internal endpoint for bootstrapping

This PS moves to use the internal keystone endpoint for boostrapping
jobs, to allow osh to be deployed when the support infrastructure may
not have been fully configured (eg - dns for public endpoints)

Change-Id: I5a9eb07b88bdc0ffbcda371bdd4c03d4da4ed78d
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Added bitstream metadata standardization spec

Change-Id: I14cfd85e946be1a8a653f14b3ae3b8421c01544c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cyborg refs/changes/65/558265/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== Cyborg FPGA Bitstream metadata spec ==================================================== Blueprint url: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-cyborg/+spec/cyborg-fpga-bitstream-metadata-spec This spec proposed the FPGA Bitstream metadata specifications for bitstream management Problem description =================== A field-programmable gate array (FPGA) is an integrated circuit designed to be configured by a customer or a designer after manufacturing. Their advantage lies in that they are sometimes significantly faster for some applications because of their parallel nature and optimality in terms of the number of gates used for a certain process. Hence, using FPGA for application acceleration in cloud has been becoming desirable. One of the encountered problems is when it comes to bitstream management, it is difficult to map bitstreams to their appropriate FPGA boards or reconfigurable regions. The aim of this proposal is to provide a standardized set of metadata which should be encapsulated together with bitstream storage. Use Cases --------- When user requests to reprogram a FPGA board with certain functionality in the cloud environment, he or she will need to retrieve a suitable bitstream from the storage. In order to find the suitable one, bitstreams need to be catagorized based on some porperties defined in metadata. Proposed change =============== For each metadata, it will be stored as a row in this Glance's image_properties in key-value pair format: column [name] holds the key whereas column [value] holds the value. Note: no batabase schema change is required. This is a standardization document to guide how to use existing Glance table for FPGA bitstreams. Given this, Cyborg will standardize the key convention as follows:: ======================================================================================== | name | value(example) | nullable | description | ======================================================================================== | bs-name | aes-128 | False | name of the bitstream | | bs-uuid | {uuid} | False | The uuid generated during synthesis | | vendor | Xilinx | False | Vendor of the card | | board | KU115 | False | Board type for this bitstream to load | | shell_id | {uuid} | True | Required shell bs-uuid for this bitstream| | version | 1.0 | False | Device version number | | driver | SDX | False | Type of driver for this bitstream | | driver_ver | 1.0 | False | Driver version | | driver_path | /path/to/driver| False | Where to retrieve the driver binary | | topology | {CLOB} | False | Function Topology | | description | description | True | Description | ======================================================================================== Here are the details regarding some definded keys. [shell_id] This field is a uuid pointing to the required shell image uuid for loading this pr bitstream. If it is null, this bitstream is a shell bitstream. [topology] This field describes the topology of function structures after the bitstream is loaded on the FPGA. In particular, it uses JSON format to visualize how physical functions, virtual functions are co-related to each other. It is vendor driver's responsibility to interpret this and prepare the porper report for Cyborg Agent. For instance:: { "pf_num": 2, "vf_num": 2, "pf": [ { "name": "pf_1", "capability": "", "kpi": "", "pci_offset": "0", "vf": [ { "name": "vf_1", "pci_offset": "1" } ] }, { "name": "pf_2", "capability": "", "kpi": "", "pci_offset": "2", "vf": [ { "name": "vf_2", "pci_offset": "3" } ] } ] } This JSON template guides Cyborg Agent to populate vf/pf/deployable list in Cyborg. Given the above JSON topology, Cyborg Driver should be able to interpret the accelerator structure as follows:: ============= =Accelerator= ============= | ============ =Deployable= ============ /\ / \ ======== ======== = pf_1 = = pf_2 = ======== ======== | | | | ======== ======== = vf_1 = = vf_2 = ======== ======== Noted: 1. Topology is not mandatory to fill in, as long as vendor driver can figure out what resources to report after the bitstream is loaded. 2. A root deployable should be created in the graph. In addition, the pfs and vfs here are all instances of deployable. Please refer to the DB objects specs regarding physical_function and virtual_function Finnally, all of the FPGA bitstreams should be TAGGED as "FPGA" in Grance. This helps distinguishing between normal VM images and bitstream images during filtering. Alternatives ------------ Data model impact ----------------- RPC API impact --------------- REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- Accelerator vendors should implement the logic in program() api to populate the loaded topology Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Li Liu <liliu1@huawei.com> Shaohe Feng <shaohe.feng@intel.com> Work Items ---------- * Provide example JSON format for bitstream * Provide example implementation of vendor driver Dependencies ============ Testing ======= Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1

subject: Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 19:47:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/110cc64e1966454a23dd0db51402c7f3b7c8e149', 'message': 'Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in
response to mundane or otherwise intentional user-triggered events,
this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure
counter and can negatively weigh hosts with recent failures. This
avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as
less likely to be picked for a subsequent scheduling
operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102

commit_message:
Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in
response to mundane or otherwise intentional user-triggered events,
this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure
counter and can negatively weigh hosts with recent failures. This
avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as
less likely to be picked for a subsequent scheduling
operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102

subject: Refactor `test_confirm_resize_server` to pass for all roles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-31 19:26:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/a683cd47b5a5268e4654dcf7369692b342ebc457', 'message': 'Refactor `test_confirm_resize_server` to pass for all roles

`test_confirm_resize_server` fails for roles that do not have
permission to perform the confirm resize API. It fails since
the cleanup tries to resize a server that is already in the resized
state [1]. This PS conditionally adds resize to addCleanup based on the
state of the server.

[1] `Details: {u'message': u"Cannot 'resize' instance
cb7c5ddc-959e-4238-9f79-a1963e60228f while it is in vm_state resized",
u'code': 409}`

commit_message:
Refactor `test_confirm_resize_server` to pass for all roles

`test_confirm_resize_server` fails for roles that do not have
permission to perform the confirm resize API. It fails since
the cleanup tries to resize a server that is already in the resized
state [1]. This PS conditionally adds resize to addCleanup based on the
state of the server.

[1] `Details: {u'message': u"Cannot 'resize' instance
cb7c5ddc-959e-4238-9f79-a1963e60228f while it is in vm_state resized",
u'code': 409}`

Change-Id: I1abb13742ed931f15d6ae18ccdc6d790b41a02bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/58/571558/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.addCleanup(self._confirm_resize_server) status = self.servers_client.show_server(self.server_id)\ ['server']['OS-EXT-STS:vm_state'] # Conditionally add addCleanup as a server can't be resized if it is # already in the resized state if status != "resized": self.addCleanup(self._resize_server, self.flavor_ref)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 17:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/workload-ref-archs/commit/c0bdada5395798b009657933a6cb6821dfe4d15e', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I816afc3b54935c4e000ed9a2bd09ecc4b283b0f2
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I816afc3b54935c4e000ed9a2bd09ecc4b283b0f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/workload-ref-archs refs/changes/35/574035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Sort image list by name when launch instance

Just like the flavor sort issue, this is another regression issue
when we shift from the legacy launch instance wizard. By default,
the image list should be ordered by name.

Change-Id: Id619ad531f7e91326694ee90c112d6a7db0d14ad
(cherry picked from commit 71c488042958648ba51db96d26be630df9bb9ca6)

commit_message:
Optimise: [LVM] Raise explicit error message when reverting

LVM driver supports extending shares and doesn't support
shrinking shares, raise explicit error message when
shrinking shares is required in revert to snapshot
process.

Depends-On: b32b706b09f6c556c84e60de2158262bef377fa2

Change-Id: Ibd4578d1e90aa396f7b496a6d07118c36c636749
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/39/433039/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(tommylikehu): We don't support shrink share in lvm driver, # so we just raise the error with explicit message. if snapshot['size'] < share['size']: raise exception.ShareShrinkingError( reason="The share can't be reverted, " "cause LVM driver don't support " "shrink share.", share_id=snapshot['share']['id'])

subject: Fix: [LVM] Can't extend share when snapshots exist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 04:53:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/3f7fc34a56d4399e8fca9e8ad3aa89de857f35ef', 'message': "Fix: [LVM] Can't extend share with snapshots exist

Lvm can't extend share when snapshot mounted and activated.
Fix this bug by using command sequence when extending share.

1. umount snapshot(s).
2. umount share.
3. deactivate share.
4. extend share.
5. activate share.
6. mount share.
7. mount snapshot(s).

commit_message:
Fix: [LVM] Can't extend share when snapshots exist

LVM can't extend share when it has snapshot which is mounted
and activated.
Fix this bug by using command sequence below when
extending share.

1. umount snapshot(s).
2. umount share.
3. deactivate share.
4. extend share.
5. activate share.
6. mount share.
7. mount snapshot(s).

Change-Id: I7ffc0a5b2256a978e58722a0bc9fd699a5d1b5a4
Closes-Bug: #1663121

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 10:50:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia-dashboard/commit/9a4c75231219585616673608b5d07c0406321375', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I65ec3ce0c72467486255868bcff79c70b9bf20f8
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I65ec3ce0c72467486255868bcff79c70b9bf20f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia-dashboard refs/changes/43/573943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
[WIP]Enable IPv6 in manila(Implement in generic driver)

Please read spec for design detail [1].

The patch list:
    1. Support IPv6 in allow_access [2].
    2. Support IPv6 in network plugins,
       implement IPv6 in lvm, dummy driver [4].
    3. Support IPv6 in generic driver (this)
    4. Support in manilaclient [3].
    5. Scenario tests
    6. Documentation

added_lines: import ipaddress self.ip_version = None data = self.add_ip_version_capability(data, True, True) def _get_configured_ip_version(self): """Get configured IP version for generic driver :returns: Supported IP version by configuration:(4,), (6,) or (). """ if self.ip_version is None: if not self.driver_handles_share_servers: detail = self.service_instance_manager.get_common_server() detail = detail['backend_details'] public_ip_version = ipaddress.ip_address( six.text_type(detail['public_address'])).version self.ip_version = (public_ip_version,) if detail['private_address']: private_ip_version = ipaddress.ip_address( six.text_type(detail['private_address'])).version if private_ip_version != public_ip_version: self.ip_version = () else: admin_ip_version = self.service_instance_manager.\ network_helper.get_admin_network_ip_version() if admin_ip_version: self.ip_version = (admin_ip_version,) else: self.ip_version = (4, 6) return self.ip_version def add_ip_version_capability(self, data, ipv4_support=False, ipv6_support=False): supported_ip_version = self._get_configured_ip_version() if ipv4_support: data['ipv4_support'] = 4 in supported_ip_version if ipv6_support: data['ipv6_support'] = 6 in supported_ip_version if (getattr(data, 'ipv4_support', None) is False and getattr(data, 'ipv6_support', None) is False): LOG.error(_LE("Backend %s capabilities 'ipv4_support' " "and 'ipv6_support' are both false."), data['share_backend_name']) return data

commit_message:
Invalid ID should return NotFound exception

If manila is not aware of the consistency group snapshot in the URI,
the appropriate response should be HTTPNotFound.
Currently, it is an empty JSON list. Correcting the behavior to return
HTTPNotFound exception.

Change-Id: I54d68da33a00e881e1b75c966192e812b41e2723
Closes-Bug: #1607434

commit_message:
[TrivialFix] optimize get share access in huawei driver

Array's API supports filtering of share access by name,
current method gets all access of the specified share,
then filter results in the driver code.
Use both PARENTID and NAME filter of array's API
instead of the old way.

Change-Id: I6a2d70ab853024e073b189be34a0a05596746885

commit_message:
Fix uuid format which should without dashed

[1] is wrong amendment which had change the uuid's format from
non-dashed to with dashed. Since [2] had been merged, this patch
fix the format without dashed by oslo.utils.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396850/6/manila/test.py
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398788

Change-Id: I5f1222863b921f36f6fe4daaac80470c324906ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/89/407889/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: host = host and host or uuidutils.generate_uuid()

commit_message:
Fix nfs server service name for rhel.

In rhel, the service name of nfs-server is "nfs-server".
However, in manila, it is hard-coded as nfs-kernel-server.

Change-Id: I9acc924690941e4dc6954aeb49f26ee5f94dbe68
Closes-Bug: #1647915
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/46/407846/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # if exist /etc/redhat-release # set nfs_service_name to nfs-server nfs_service_name = 'nfs-kernel-server' try: self._ssh_exec(server, ['sudo', 'ls', '/etc/redhat-release']) nfs_service_name = 'nfs-server' except exception.ProcessExecutionError: pass server, ['sudo', 'service', nfs_service_name, 'status'], server, ['sudo', 'service', nfs_service_name, 'restart'])

commit_message:
Remove driver config docs from devref

As agreed in manila's weekly meeting of Dec 1st 2016, all
driver documents that refer to configuration or deployment
should be removed from the developer reference repository.

Change-Id: I760a4ed5caa53850280f167ef638d0da84fe62b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/16/405516/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. Copyright 2015 Red Hat, Inc. All Rights Reserved. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. GlusterFS driver ================ GlusterFS driver uses GlusterFS, an open source distributed file system, as the storage backend for serving file shares to manila clients. Supported shared filesystems ---------------------------- - NFS (access by IP) Supported Operations -------------------- - Create share - Delete share - Allow share access (rw) - Deny share access - With volume layout: - Create snapshot - Delete snapshot - Create share from snapshot Requirements ------------ - Install glusterfs-server package, version >= 3.5.x, on the storage backend. - Install NFS-Ganesha, version >=2.1, if using NFS-Ganesha as the NFS server for the GlusterFS backend. - Install glusterfs and glusterfs-fuse package, version >=3.5.x, on the manila host. - Establish network connection between the manila host and the storage backend. Manila driver configuration setting ----------------------------------- The following parameters in the manila's configuration file need to be set: - `share_driver` = manila.share.drivers.glusterfs.GlusterfsShareDriver The following configuration parameters are optional: - `glusterfs_nfs_server_type` = <NFS server type used by the GlusterFS backend, `Gluster` or `Ganesha`. `Gluster` is the default type> - `glusterfs_share_layout` = <share layout used>; cf. :ref:`glusterfs_layouts` - `glusterfs_path_to_private_key` = <path to manila host's private key file> - `glusterfs_server_password` = <password of remote GlusterFS server machine> If Ganesha NFS server is used (``glusterfs_nfs_server_type = Ganesha``), then by default the Ganesha server is supposed to run on the manila host and is managed by local commands. If it's deployed somewhere else, then it's managed via ssh, which can be configured by the following parameters: - `glusterfs_ganesha_server_ip` - `glusterfs_ganesha_server_username` - `glusterfs_ganesha_server_password` In lack of ``glusterfs_ganesha_server_password`` ssh access will fall back to key based authentication, using the key specified by ``glusterfs_path_to_private_key``, or, in lack of that, a key at one of the OpenSSH-style default key locations (*~/.ssh/id_{r,d,ecd}sa*). For further (non driver specific) configuration of Ganesha, see :doc:`ganesha`. It is recommended to consult with :doc:`ganesha`: :ref:`ganesha_known_issues` too. Layouts have also their set of parameters, see :ref:`glusterfs_layouts` about that. .. _glusterfs_layouts: Layouts ------- New in Liberty, multiple share layouts can be used with glusterfs driver. A layout is a strategy of allocating storage from GlusterFS backends for shares. Currently there are two layouts implemented: - `directory mapped layout` (or `directory layout`, or `dir layout` for short): a share is backed by top-level subdirectories of a given GlusterFS volume. Directory mapped layout is the default and backward compatible with Kilo. The following setting explicitly specifies its usage: ``glusterfs_share_layout = layout_directory.GlusterfsDirectoryMappedLayout``. Options: - `glusterfs_target`: address of the volume that hosts the directories. If it's of the format `<glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid>`, then the manila host is expected to be part of the GlusterFS cluster of the volume and GlusterFS management happens through locally calling the ``gluster`` utility. If it's of the format `<username>@<glustervolserver>:/<glustervolid>`, then we ssh to `<username>@<glustervolserver>` to execute ``gluster`` (`<username>` is supposed to have administrative privileges on `<glustervolserver>`). - `glusterfs_mount_point_base` = <base path of GlusterFS volume mounted on manila host> (optional; defaults to *$state_path*\ ``/mnt``, where *$state_path* defaults to ``/var/lib/manila``) Limitations: - directory layout does not support snapshot operations. - `volume mapped layout` (or `volume layout`, or `vol layout` for short): a share is backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. Volume mapped layout is new in Liberty. It can be chosen by setting ``glusterfs_share_layout = layout_volume.GlusterfsVolumeMappedLayout``. Options (required): - `glusterfs_servers` - `glusterfs_volume_pattern` Volume mapped layout is implemented as a common backend of the glusterfs and glusterfs-native drivers; see the description of these options in :doc:`glusterfs_native_driver`: :ref:`gluster_native_manila_conf`. Gluster NFS with volume mapped layout ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ A special configuration choice is :: glusterfs_nfs_server_type = Gluster glusterfs_share_layout = layout_volume.GlusterfsVolumeMappedLayout that is, Gluster NFS used to export whole volumes. All other GlusterFS backend configurations (including GlusterFS set up with glusterfs-native) require the ``nfs.export-volumes = off`` GlusterFS setting. Gluster NFS with volume layout requires ``nfs.export-volumes = on``. ``nfs.export-volumes`` is a *cluster-wide* setting, so a given GlusterFS cluster cannot host a share backend with Gluster NFS + volume layout and other share backend configurations at the same time. There is another caveat with ``nfs.export-volumes``: setting it to ``on`` without enough care is a security risk, as the default access control for the volume exports is "allow all". For this reason, while the ``nfs.export-volumes = off`` setting is automatically set by manila for all other share backend configurations, ``nfs.export-volumes = on`` is *not* set by manila in case of a Gluster NFS with volume layout setup. It's left to the GlusterFS admin to make this setting in conjunction with the associated safeguards (that is, for those volumes of the cluster which are not used by manila, access restrictions have to be manually configured through the ``nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject}`` options). Known Restrictions ------------------ - The driver does not support network segmented multi-tenancy model, but instead works over a flat network, where the tenants share a network. - If NFS Ganesha is the NFS server used by the GlusterFS backend, then the shares can be accessed by NFSv3 and v4 protocols. However, if Gluster NFS is used by the GlusterFS backend, then the shares can only be accessed by NFSv3 protocol. - All manila shares, which map to subdirectories within a GlusterFS volume, are currently created within a single GlusterFS volume of a GlusterFS storage pool. - The driver does not provide read-only access level for shares. - Assume that share S is exported through Gluster NFS, and tenant machine T has mounted S. If at this point access of T to S is revoked through `access-deny`, the pre-existing mount will be still usable and T will still be able to access the data in S as long as that mount is in place. (This violates the principle *Access deny should always result in immediate loss of access to the share*, see http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/069109.html.) The :mod:`manila.share.drivers.glusterfs` Module ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. automodule:: manila.share.drivers.glusterfs :noindex: :members: :undoc-members: :show-inheritance:

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I955537ca8049318daae3831f2da477f24ae5888c

subject: Change huawei driver to only pass needed info while replica creating
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 03:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/commit/921dbd6cbc79eb1c1ce19da093477ad5ce27e96c', 'message': "Change huawei driver to only pass needed info while replica creating

Sometimes, while creating new replica by huawei driver, the operation
occasionally fails due to the lazy loading exception.

The reason of this exception is because huawei driver passes the entire
share info as a RPC parameter, while RPC call serializes the share info,
there's attribute that can't be proceeded because of DB lazy loading.

This patch fixes this bug by only passing the needed share info to the
RPC call.

Change-Id: I8c522fab23c23c335d20c71ccf3f44d13ed6d852
Closes-Bug: #1642453
"}]
commit_message:
Change huawei driver to only pass needed info while replica creating

Sometimes, while creating new replica by huawei driver, the operation
occasionally fails due to the lazy loading exception.

The reason of this exception is because huawei driver passes the entire
share info as a RPC parameter, while RPC call serializes the share info,
there's attribute that can't be proceeded because of DB lazy loading.

This patch fixes this bug by only passing the needed share info to the
RPC call.

Change-Id: I8c522fab23c23c335d20c71ccf3f44d13ed6d852
Closes-Bug: #1642453
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/17/398717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix CIFS share access-deny do not take effect in generic driver

When access is denied to a share for a client that had
access, the client is still able to read and write as it
could before access was denied.

Restart the CIFS service so that the access changes take
effect.

Change-Id: I12241e305fb3353cf800a691e1bedb08dd5eecef
Close-Bug: #1641566

commit_message:
huawei driver adds used capacity check before shrinking

Currently, huawei driver doesn't have the check of already used
capacity for thin type share, comparing to the new size expected
to shrink to.

Add this used capacity verification.

Change-Id: I7c19524cfc7b803c250c585d9895de1438e5bc99
Closes-Bug: #1639676

commit_message:
Change entity value while huawei driver records replication id

Huawei driver currently uses share id as the entity field of
driver_private_data table, however, this'll incur a problem that
cannot create replica for the same share whose original replica
has been deleted, because DB will raise 'duplicated entity'
exception.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: If5d85a9c6c24c0e7dcbb7b5dd7420f34bc3239d3
Closes-Bug: #1638196

commit_message:
Clear access after promotion for huawei driver

According to huawei driver's implementation, after replica promotion,
the access of original active replica should be cleared, cause huawei
driver only supports 'dr' type.

The access clear request should be sent by RPC, to tell the service
that the original active replica resides on to execute.

This patch implements this logic.

Change-Id: Ib7c24c248a10e88bd406ccd75d3f5acca6c96df4
Closes-Bug: #1637097

commit_message:
Resync replication of huawei backend while it's to recover

Currently, once the replication of huawei backend is broken,
the replica state will always be error, even if the replication
connection of huawei backends has recovered.

This's because huawei replication is asynchronous, when the
replication connection is recovered, we need to launch a resync
process manually, then the replication will recover to a
normal status.

Add a resync step in the replica update process, if the replication
status of huawei backend is "to recover".

Change-Id: I2314f56d493610efda226b77b1fe3e171209f0c0
Closes-Bug: #1636401

commit_message:
Cleanup Newton Release Notes

This adds the earliest-version directive to only show the Newton release
which was 3.0.0.
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/newton.html

Also, do not generate an index file, it is empty, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/genindex.html

Change-Id: Ibe04a71bbb52e4e4389622816b067eed4870dfc8
